alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Pulaski, eastern Wythe and northwestern Carroll Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gunton Park, or near Max Meadows, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pulaski... Wytheville... Max Meadows... Allisonia... Patterson... Fort Chiswell... and Draper. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
